solution_line_template: First find the total number of weeks the Bobbit worm preys on the fish: {initial_weeks_prey} weeks + {additional_weeks_prey} week = <<{initial_weeks_prey}+{additional_weeks_prey}={total_weeks_prey}>>{total_weeks_prey} weeks
Then multiply that number by the number of days per week: {total_weeks_prey} weeks * {days_per_week} days/week = {total_days_prey} days

Then multiply that number by the number of fish the worm eats per day to find how many fish it eats total: {total_days_prey} days * {fish_eaten_per_day} fish/day = <<{total_days_prey}*{fish_eaten_per_day}={total_fish_eaten}>>{total_fish_eaten} fish

Then add the number of fish James adds to the starting number of fish to find the ending number of fish: {initial_fish} fish + {fish_added} fish = <<{initial_fish}+{fish_added}={fish_before_eating}>>{fish_before_eating} fish

Then subtract the number of eaten fish to find the number of surviving fish: {fish_before_eating} fish - {total_fish_eaten} fish = <<{fish_before_eating}-{total_fish_eaten}={surviving_fish}>>{surviving_fish} fish
